floater.name: phototools
floater.title: Aperture Phototools Suite
floater.floater.string: Move Camera Up and Down, Left and Right

panel.name: P_Environment
panel.label: Evn
panel.tool_tip: Env Presets, Quick Settings & Detailed Env Editing.

check_box.label: Only My Settings
check_box.name: show_my_settings_checkbox
check_box.tool_tip: Show only environmnet settings inyour settings folder

text.name: WL Sky
text.tool_tip: Select and manage sky presets to adjust the atmospheric lighting.

text.name: WL Water
text.tool_tip: Choose water presets to modify reflections and surface properties.

button.name: Sunrise
button.label: Sunrise
button.tool_tip: Set the environment to sunrise lighting conditions.(PBR Enabled)

button.name: Noon
button.label: Noon
button.tool_tip: Adjust lighting to simulate the brightness of midday.(PBR Enabled)

button.name: Sunset
button.label: Sunset
button.tool_tip: Apply sunset lighting for warm, golden hues.(PBR Enabled)

button.name: Midnight
button.label: Midnight
button.tool_tip: Switch to nighttime settings for low-light environments. (PBR Enabled)

button.name: Revert to Region Default
button.label: Shared Environment
button.tool_tip: Revert to the region's shared environment settings. (PBR status depends on region settings. Check region environment for PBR details.)

button.name: new_sky_preset
button.label: New Sky Preset
button.tool_tip: Create new environment preset based on the currently loaded sky settings.

button.name: new_water_preset
button.label: New Water Preset
button.tool_tip: Create new environment preset based on the currently loaded water settings.

panel.label: Atmosphere
panel.name: panel_ap_settings_sky_atmos
panel.string: Intensity of lighting effects such as realistically bright skies and dynamic exposure. 1.0 is the default, 0 is off, values between 0 and 1 are mixing Ambient with HDR.

text.name: probe_ambiance_label
text.tool_tip: Irradiance control. When not zero, enables HDR lighting model.

text.name: cloud_density_label
text.tool_tip: Cloud XY/Density - Use the X and Y sliders to change the horizontal position of all clouds in the sky. The D slider affects the overall density of the individual clouds; at low settings you will see thin, wispy clouds, and at higher settings you will see thicker, more solid clouds.

text.name: water_fog_label
text.tool_tip: Water Fog Color - This changes the color of the volume tint of the water, essentially defining the color of the water itself. If your water has no fog, it will appear crystal clear and colorless.

text.name: normal_map_label
text.tool_tip: Normal Map - Image used for determining reflections and refractions. Any texture may be used for this setting- but true normal maps work best.

text.name: local lights_label
text.tool_tip: Defines how many local light sources are rendered simultaneously. Setting this to 0 turns off all local lights. Higher values may impact performance in complex scenes.

text.name: T_Local_Lights
text.tool_tip: Number of local lights to render.

check_box.tool_tip: Displays wireframe boxes around all light sources in the scene, helping to visualize the placement and range of lights for debugging or scene setup.
check_box.label: Show Bounding Boxes for All Lights in Scene
check_box.name: Lights

check_box.tool_tip: Displays the effective radius of selected light sources, allowing you to see how far the light reaches in the scene. Useful for fine-tuning lighting setups.
check_box.label: Show Light Radius for Selected Light(s)
check_box.name: Show Light Radius for Selection

text.name: T_Shadow_Types
text.tool_tip: Controls the types of shadows rendered from light sources. Point lights without projection features create lighting effects but do not cast shadows. Projected light textures remain visible regardless of this setting.

check_box.name: CH_B_Render_HDR_Enabled
check_box.label: Enable PBR Emissive Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: Allows PBR emissive materials to contribute colored light within reflection probes and render glow effects correctly.

check_box.label: Enable Reflection Probe Selection
check_box.name: checkbox select probes
check_box.tool_tip: Enable to select and inspect reflection probes in the scene.

text.name: ReflectionDetailText
text.tool_tip: Determines the level of detail in reflections. Static Only reflects non-moving objects, while higher settings include dynamic objects and real-time reflections.

text.name: ReflectionProbeText
text.tool_tip: Controls how much of the scene is covered by reflections. 'Manual Only' reflects selected objects, while 'Full Scene' includes everything in view.

text.name: Probe_Resolution
text.tool_tip: Defines the resolution of reflection probes. Higher resolutions provide more detailed reflections but may increase memory usage and require a viewer restart to apply. Settings above 128 can consume significant amounts of video RAM, potentially impacting performance on systems with limited GPU resources.

text.name: T_Reflection_Distance
text.tool_tip: Controls the visibility range for reflections, affecting reflection detail and performance across reflection probes, mirrors, and screen space reflections. Higher values increase the distance at which reflections are visible, enhancing detail but increasing performance cost. [Default: Check Setting]

text.name: T_Probe_UpdatePeriod
text.tool_tip: Time in seconds between updates for Static or Static & Dynamic reflection probes. Lower values update more frequently but cost more performance. Does not affect Realtime probes. [Default: 2.0]

text.name: T_Probe_MaxLocalAmb
text.tool_tip: Sets the maximum effective ambient contribution from local lights (projectors, point lights) captured by reflection probes. [Default: 4.0]

check_box.label: Enable Screen Space Reflections (SSR)
check_box.name: ScreenSpaceReflections
check_box.tool_tip: Enables reflections based on the screen's current view. Provides realistic reflections for objects within the camera's field of view, but may miss details outside the screen. Can impact performance depending on the complexity of the scene. This toggle enables/disables the SSR settings below.

text.name: SSR_GlossySamplesText
text.tool_tip: Controls the maximum number of samples used for glossy SSR. Higher values improve reflection quality (smoothness) but increase performance cost. [Default: 4]

text.name: T_SSR_Iterations
text.tool_tip: Controls the number of refinement steps for SSR. Higher values improve reflection quality and reduce noise but increase performance cost significantly. [Default: Check Setting]

text.name: T_SSR_RayStep
text.tool_tip: Determines the length of each step taken when tracing reflection rays. Smaller values increase accuracy, especially for nearby reflections, but cost more performance. Larger values trace faster but may miss finer details. [Default: Check Setting]

check_box.label: Enable Mirrors
check_box.name: Mirrors
check_box.tool_tip: Enables real-time mirror reflections. Accurately reflects the environment, including objects and avatars, but may significantly affect performance due to the additional rendering load. This toggle enables/disables the Mirror settings below.

text.name: MirrorResolutionText
text.tool_tip: Sets the resolution for mirror reflections. Higher values produce sharper reflections but require more processing power. Enabled by the 'Enable Mirrors' checkbox.

text.name: HeroProbeUpdateText
text.tool_tip: Adjusts how frequently mirror reflections are updated. Higher settings offer smoother real-time reflections but can impact performance. Enabled by the 'Enable Mirrors' checkbox.

text.name: T_Mirror_Distance
text.tool_tip: Sets the maximum distance (in meters) mirrors will render reflections. Enabled by the 'Enable Mirrors' checkbox. [Default: 8]

panel.name: P_Lens
panel.label: Lens
panel.tool_tip: Depth of Field, Glow and Chromatic Aberration settings.

check_box.name: UseFarClip
check_box.label: Depth of Field focus follows pointer

button.name: FocusPointRenderToggle
button.tool_tip: Toggle the focus point crosshair display. The crosshair is yellow when free and red when locked.

check_box.name: DoFInEditMode
check_box.label: Keep DoF enabled in Edit Mode

text.name: T_CA_Red_Cyan
text.tool_tip: Controls the radial Red/Cyan fringe amount for Chromatic Aberration.

text.name: T_CA_Grn_Mag
text.tool_tip: Controls the radial Green/Magenta fringe amount for Chromatic Aberration.

text.name: T_CA_Blue_Yel
text.tool_tip: Controls the radial Blue/Yellow fringe amount for Chromatic Aberration.

panel.name: P_Post
panel.label: Post
panel.tool_tip: Post FX: HDR, Color Grading, Sharpening, Grain.

check_box.name: CH_B_Render_HDR_Enabled
check_box.label: Enable HDR
check_box.tool_tip: Enables the High Dynamic Range rendering pipeline for enhanced lighting, auto-exposure, and tonemapping effects.

text.name: T_Saturation
text.tool_tip: Adjusts the overall color saturation. 0.0 is black and white, 1.0 is normal color, values above 1.0 increase saturation.

text.name: T_LumWeightR
text.tool_tip: Controls the weight of the Red channel in luminance calculation.

button.name: ResetLumWeightRBtn
button.label: D
button.tool_tip: Reset Red luminance weight to default (0.299).

text.name: T_LumWeightG
text.tool_tip: Controls the weight of the Green channel in luminance calculation.

button.name: ResetLumWeightGBtn
button.label: D
button.tool_tip: Reset Green luminance weight to default (0.587).

text.name: T_LumWeightB
text.tool_tip: Controls the weight of the Blue channel in luminance calculation.

button.name: ResetLumWeightBBtn
button.label: D
button.tool_tip: Reset Blue luminance weight to default (0.114).

text.name: T_Sharpening
text.tool_tip: Adjusts the sharpness of the overall image using Contrast-Adaptive Sharpening (CAS). Higher values enhance image clarity by increasing contrast around edges, which can improve visual detail. Excessive sharpening may introduce artifacts or make the image look harsh.

check_box.name: Show HUD Attachments
check_box.label: Show HUD Attachments
check_box.tool_tip: Displays all HUD (Heads-Up Display) attachments currently worn by your avatar. Disabling this hides HUDs, which can be useful for reducing screen clutter or improving performance.

check_box.name: Render Attached Particle
check_box.label: Show Avatar Particles
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle rendering of particle effects emitted from avatar attachments.

check_box.name: Render Attached Lights
check_box.label: Show Attached Lights
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle rendering of light sources attached to avatars, such as face lights.

check_box.name: CH_B_Render_Avatars
check_box.label: Show Avatars
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle rendering of all avatars (including your own).

text.name: T_AvatarDisplay
text.tool_tip: Select how avatars are displayed based on complexity or friend status.

text.name: Maximum complexity
text.tool_tip: Set the complexity limit above which avatars may be derendered or simplified.

text.name: T_Avi_Count
text.tool_tip: Set the maximum number of nearby avatars to render fully.

text.name: T_Avi_Physics
text.tool_tip: Adjust the detail level for avatar physics calculations.

text.name: T_Animation_Speed
text.tool_tip: Adjust the playback speed multiplier for all avatar animations.

text.name: T_Hover_Height
text.tool_tip: Adjust your avatar's vertical offset (hover) from the ground.

button.name: Rebake Texture
button.tool_tip: Forces the viewer to rebake or refresh your avatar's appearance textures. This can fix issues like blurry skins, clothing not loading properly, or other texture-related problems.
button.label: Force Appearance Update (Rebake)

check_box.name: CH_B_FSLimitFramerate
check_box.label: Enable FPS Limit
check_box.tool_tip: Enable to activate the frame rate limit set by the controls below.

check_box.name: UseFarClip
check_box.label: Enable Draw Distance
check_box.tool_tip: Enable to apply the custom Draw Distance limit set below; disable to render maximum distance.

check_box.name: RednerLod1
check_box.label: Enable Dynamic LOD
check_box.tool_tip: Enable automatic adjustment of object/terrain detail using factors below; disable to force max detail.

check_box.name: CH_B_APRenderEnableFullbright
check_box.label: Enable Fullbright Textures
check_box.tool_tip: Renders textures at their maximum brightness, ignoring scene lighting.

check_box.name: UssOcclusion1
check_box.label: Enable Occlusion Culling
check_box.tool_tip: Improves performance by not drawing objects hidden from view.

check_box.name: Anisotropic
check_box.label: Enable Anisotropic Filtering
check_box.tool_tip: Improves texture clarity on surfaces viewed at an angle.

check_box.name: CH_B_TransparentWater
check_box.label: Enable Transparent Water
check_box.tool_tip: Render water as transparent.

text.name: T_Max_FPS
text.tool_tip: Set the maximum frame rate (FPS); requires 'Enable FPS Limit' checkbox.

text.name: T_Draw_Distance
text.tool_tip: Define the maximum viewing distance; requires 'Enable Draw Distance' checkbox.

text.name: T_Object_Detail
text.tool_tip: Manage the Level of Detail (LOD) factor for non-terrain objects.

text.name: T_Terrain_Quality
text.tool_tip: Fine-tune terrain detail level (LOD); requires 'Enable Dynamic LOD' checkbox.

text.name: T_Particle_Cnt
text.tool_tip: Adjust the maximum number of particles visible at once.

text.name: T_Terrain_Scale
text.tool_tip: Modify the terrain detail level or morphing distance.

text.name: T_Sky_Detail
text.tool_tip: Determine the sky's rendering complexity and detail level.

text.name: T_Antialiasing_Type
text.tool_tip: Select the method used to smooth jagged edges; requires a viewer restart to apply.

text.name: T_Anti-aliasing
text.tool_tip: Choose the quality level for the selected Antialiasing method.

text.name: T_Texture_Bumpiness
text.tool_tip: Control the intensity and perceived depth of normal and bump maps on textures.

text.name: T_RestrictMaxTexture
text.tool_tip: Set the maximum resolution the viewer will load for textures to manage memory usage.

check_box.name: CH_B_Show_Color_Under_Cursor
check_box.label: Show RGB-I Color Values Under Cursor
check_box.tool_tip: Displays the RGB (Red, Green, Blue) and intensity (I) color values of the pixel directly under your cursor.

text.name: T_UI_Scaling
text.tool_tip: Adjust the overall size scaling of the user interface elements.

slider_bar.name: zoom_slider
slider_bar.tool_tip: This simply moves the camera in and out. NOTE: It does not make the camera ZOOM in RL terms! It has no effect on the FOV. Use the 'View angle' slider for real zooming.

joystick_track.name: cam_track_stick
joystick_track.tool_tip: Move camera up and down, left and right.

text.name: T_Zoom
text.tool_tip: In real world terms this is a Zoom feature. This will change the field of view in your viewer window. It is the same as hitting Ctrl + 0 or Ctrl+8. NOTE: This will not function if you have flycam enabled (3D SpaceNavigator).

text.name: T_Zoom_Speed
text.tool_tip: Controls how fast/slow the camera will zoom in and out. Higher values produce slower and smother zoom.

text.name: T_Camera_Lag
text.tool_tip: Amount camera lags behind avatar motion (0 = none, 30 = avatar velocity).

text.name: T_Camera_Offset
text.tool_tip: Controls how far the camera is offset/distance from the default point of view.

text.name: T_Camera_Smoothing
text.tool_tip: Controls how smoothly the camera starts and stops. Higher values produce smoother (and somewhat slower) movement.

check_box.label: Display avatar in mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: Display avatar and attachments below neck while in mouselook. Default is OFF.
check_box.name: first_person_avatar_visible

check_box.label: Smooth Mouselook Movements
check_box.tool_tip: Smooths out motion of mouse when in mouselook mode.
check_box.name: MouseSmooth

check_box.label: Clicking your avatar keeps camera position
check_box.name: clickonavatarkeepscamera
check_box.tool_tip: Normally, clicking on your avatar resets the camera position. This option removes this behavior.

check_box.label: Reset camera position after teleport
check_box.name: FSResetCameraOnTP
check_box.tool_tip: Normally, the camera position gets reset when teleporting (within a region). This option prevents this behavior.

check_box.label: Allow the camera to move w/o constraints
check_box.name: ignorecameraconstraints
check_box.tool_tip: Ignores the 'push' the simulator applies to your camera to keep it out of objects. REQUIRES RESTART!

check_box.label: Reset camera position on avatar movement
check_box.name: resetcameraonmovement
check_box.tool_tip: Resets the camera to its default position when you move the avatar

text.name: T_Mouse_Sensitivity
text.tool_tip: Controls responsiveness of mouse when in mouselook mode.

text.name: T_LR_Axis
text.tool_tip: Adjusts the sensitivity for horizontal camera movement. Lower values allow for finer control, while higher values increase movement speed.

text.name: T_UD_Axis
text.tool_tip: Adjusts the sensitivity for vertical camera movement. Reducing this setting improves precision for small adjustments.

text.name: T_IO_Axis
text.tool_tip: Controls the sensitivity of forward and backward camera movement, similar to dollying in and out in real-world cinematography. This moves the entire camera closer to or farther from the subject, changing perspective rather than adjusting the Field of View (FOV) like a zoom would. Lower values provide more precise control for smooth, gradual dolly movements, while higher values increase movement speed for quicker adjustments.

text.name: T_Tilt
text.tool_tip: Adjusts the responsiveness of the pitch (tilting up and down) movement. Reducing this setting makes camera tilting more gradual.

text.name: T_Spin
text.tool_tip: Modifies the sensitivity for yaw (rotational movement left and right). Lower settings slow rotation, useful for precise framing.

text.name: T_Roll
text.tool_tip: Adjusts the sensitivity of the roll movement, which tilts the camera sideways, similar to rotating your head left or right. Lower values provide finer control for precise adjustments, while higher values make the roll more responsive. Note: This setting will not have any effect if 'Enable Auto Leveling' is enabled, as auto leveling keeps the camera horizon perfectly level, preventing any roll movement.

text.name: T_Zoom_Speed
text.tool_tip: Controls the method for zooming in and out by adjusting the cameras focal length or vertical Field of View (FOV), similar to changing the lens on a real camera. This affects how much of the scene is visible and how 'zoomed in' the view appears. To activate zoom functionality, set the Zoom Axis Mapping to '4'. This setting does not affect the smoothness of the zoom but rather determines the range of FOV adjustment, allowing for precise control over the cameras zoom level.

text.name: T_Feathering
text.tool_tip: Controls the fluidity of camera movements. Moving the slider to the right makes the camera rigid and responsive to joystick input. Moving it left makes the camera behave more like it has inertia, ideal for cinematic fly-by shots.

spinner.label: Zoom Axis Mapping
spinner.name: JoystickAxis6
spinner.tool_tip: Determines which joystick or mouse axis controls the zoom function. Set this to '4' to enable zoom via the joystick.

check_box.label: Enable 3D Mouse
check_box.tool_tip: Enables or disables joystick/3D mouse support for controlling the camera.
check_box.name: enable_joystick
CB_ZoomDirect
check_box.label: Enable Zoom Control (See Tool Tip!)
check_box.tool_tip: Activates zoom control with the 3D mouse. Ensure the 'Zoom Axis Mapping' is set to '4' for proper functionality.

check_box.name: CB_AutoLeveling
check_box.label: Enable Auto Leveling (Prevents Camera Roll)
check_box.tool_tip: Keeps the camera level, preventing unintended roll. This is useful for maintaining a stable horizon while moving.

check_box.name: CB_Move_Avatar
check_box.label: Use the 3D Mouse to move the avatar
check_box.tool_tip: Allows the 3D mouse to control avatar movement instead of just the camera.

check_box.name: CB_Move_Objects
check_box.label: Use the 3D Mouse to move objects (building)
check_box.tool_tip: Enables the 3D mouse for object manipulation during building and editing.

check_box.label: Show the Current FOV of Viewer Screen
check_box.tool_tip: Displays the current vertical field of view (FOV) overlay. Adjust the FOV using the zoom slider.
check_box.name: CAM_Show_FOV

check_box.tool_tip: Displays detailed information about the cameras position, orientation, and movement. Useful for photography, machinima, or precise editing.
check_box.label: Show Detailed Camera Position Data
check_box.name: Camera

button.name: BTN_Graphics_Presets_Save
button.label: Save
button.tool_tip: Save current Phototools settings as a new preset.
